author: dlr
msg: Corrected JavaDoc for map(String, String).

author: dlr
msg: o Added a note about the lack of thread safety in this class
(inconsequential, but perhaps worth noting).
o Taught map(String, String) to first try using getResourceAsStream()
to load the XML file from the classpath.
o Renamed baseDirectory to basePath, since this class now does loading
from the classpath as well as from the file system.
o If the inclusionRule for an element is empty, don't append / -- it
screws up getResourceAsStream() (and thus resource loading from the
classpath).

author: jvanzyl
msg: - adding the following packages to stratum, they are still in rough form
but they need to be tossed into public view so we can move forward with
the release. i will put in what i know works and put in the prop/xml config
classes when they fully work. so here's a little breakdown.
configuration package:
hopefully this will give us the functionality of our ExtendedProperties
and hopefully also be compatible with the preferences API, if at all
possible. I'm working on a properties config by refactoring the
ExtendedProperties further to remove the i/o portions of the class and
offload the i/o operations to the resources package that will come in
Real Soon Now (c).
exception package:
this are the exception classes that dan worked on, the only think i can
think of here is make any changes that will allow easy use under 1.4
which supports chainable exceptions. the recommendation is in Effective
Java by Joshua Bloch and i put a note in the directory as a reminder.
lifecycle package:
this is all directly lifted from avalon but i put the configuration
interfaces in with the lifecycle stuff, everything is up for change as
we integrate things so if you don't like it speak up.
The remaining packages that i still have and am working on are
the factory, pool and resources packages which i will try to get in
place Real Soon Now (c) they actually work so i might just toss them
into the repository before i leave for Nevada on Sunday.

author: dlr
msg: Minor clean up, including some tweaks to map() to move towards a more
streamy implementation (looking towards the day when class loading can
be used instead of file system access).

author: dlr
msg: o Minor formatting fixes.
o Added comments to isPlural(String) regarding I18N-ability and
default return value.
